meanings.definition: The act of placing a masthead at the top of a newspaper or magazine.
meanings.sent1: The mastheading of the newspaper was done with precision.
meanings.sent2: The mastheading of the magazine caught the reader's attention.
meanings.sent3: The mastheading of the newspaper made the editor smile.
meanings.sent4: Her mastheading of the magazine was like a crown on a king.
meanings.sent5: The mastheading of the newspaper shone brightly like a beacon.

meanings.definition: The title or heading at the top of a newspaper or magazine.
meanings.sent1: The mastheading of the newspaper displayed the latest news.
meanings.sent2: Readers often glance at the mastheading before diving into the articles.
meanings.sent3: The mastheading of the magazine was bold and eye-catching.
meanings.sent4: The mastheading of the newspaper stood tall like a proud flag.
meanings.sent5: The mastheading of the magazine was like a welcoming sign at the entrance.

meanings.definition: To place a masthead at the top of a newspaper or magazine.
meanings.sent1: She mastheadings the newspaper every morning before printing.
meanings.sent2: The editor mastheadings the magazine with care and attention.
meanings.sent3: He mastheadings the newspaper quickly to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent4: Mastheading the magazine felt like putting the finishing touch on a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: They mastheadings the newspaper as if it were a work of art.
